column1: length ball, just wide outside off, and Babar looks to drive. Misses
length ball angling into his body, and tucked off his waist to square leg
full on off, and angling into leg stump. Fakhar tries to nudge it to square leg, but the ball hits his knee-roll and dribbles away to the off side
full on middle, and he prods forward to drive. Mistimed past the bowler's right to mid off this time
length ball, wide outside off, and the drive away from his body is sliced only to cover
length ball, wide outside off, and the punch whizzes past the outside edge to the keeper
back of a length, wide outside off, and he stands tall, before pulling over mid-wicket for the game's first four!
length ball, wide outside off again, and drilled through point! Stays on the back foot, and hammers a back-foot punch for back-to-back boundaries
full, just outside off stump, and defended with soft hands. Ball rolls back to Dala
full on off stump, and worked off his toes past the fielder at midwicket! Excellent timing, and the ball sprints away to the cow-corner boundary
plays an upper cut over short third man! Short ball, just outside off, and Babar backs away... waits for the ball to get to him... and then steers a cheeky shot over the infield
length ball angling in, and pulled along the ground to deep backward square. Seventeen off that over
length ball, wide outside off, and the cut has been edged past first slip! Diving effort not good enough from the cordon, and that's another boundary added to Babar's account
back of a length just outside off, and he rides the bounce to steer a shot to third man
back of a length, cramping Fakhar. Mistimes a whip to the leg side, and they sneak across for a single
length ball, wide outside off, and Babar can't help himself. Tries to smoke a cut through the off-side, but he's toe-ended the shot, and point dives to his right to take a smart catch
full and wide outside off, and the outswinger is driven to backward point
full outside off, and driven with the bat's open face. Well struck, but finds the fielder at cover
back of a length on leg stump, and he tucks this fine past the keeper's left for four! Gloves it, replays suggest
length ball on leg stump, and he defends with soft hands off the back foot
smoked! Length ball, not fast enough (130kph) and he swivels to smack a pull over deep midwicket! Into the crowd
length ball, but again outside leg stump. Fakhar swivels to pull once more, but misses
length ball on middle, and Fakhar waits for that to get to him, before pulling behind square - past the square-leg umpire - for another leg-side boundary
slightly fuller, but still pretty short. Fakhar looks to muscle a shot over square leg, but the ball hits his thigh-guard and rolls past the man at short fine leg!
length ball on leg, and worked off his hips to deep midwicket. Rassie runs across from deep square leg to cut the ball off. Another skyscraper of an over from Pakistan
length ball on off, and extra bounce hits Rizwan near the bat's top half. Looked to drive, but didn't account for the extra lift
length ball on middle, and angling into his body. Nurdled off his waist to the fielder at square leg for a quick single
full on middle, and the inswinger is muscled towards the leg side. Hits the bat's inside half and rolls away to short fine leg
length ball on middle, and angling away from Fakhar. Shapes up to cut, but can't beat the infield
back of a length on leg stump, and he tries to pull but misses. The ball hits his body and rolls away to short fine leg
full on middle, and angling away from Fakhar. But he had backed away to make some extra room anyway, and therefore the ball is too far from him. Through to the keeper
length ball, wide outside off, and he tries to smoke a cut shot behind square. Mistimed to point
back of a length on off, and he rides the bounce to bunt a defensive shot to cover. They scamper across for one
full on middle, and drilled down the ground - past the non-striker - to mid on

full and wide outside off, but Fakhar tries to smack this over cover. Walks down the ground to smash a six, but he's lost his balance, and the shot has been sliced to third man. Shamsi gets under the ball and times his dive well to take a catch falling forward
back of a length outside off, but coming inwards. Too close to his body for the cut, and he mistimes it to deep point
length ball on middle, and worked off his hips to square leg with ease. Calls for the second run, and they scamper across for the double
length ball, outside off, and he starts off with a slower ball. He's through the punch-shot too early, and the ball takes the outside edge to third man
short ball, wide outside off, and he slaps a cut to the sweeper-fielder on the off side
full on middle, and driven with soft hands to mid on. They pinch another quick single
good length, wide outside off, and the late cut goes to third man for a walking single
length ball on middle, and defended down the ground to mid-on. They jog across for another single
full, slightly wide outside off, and tapped with soft hands behind square. Ball rolls away to third man on this occasion
full on middle, and turning into leg stump. Clipped into the vacant midwicket region
full on leg stump, and slog swept behind square! No chance for the fielder at deep backward square. Gets to the pitch of the ball, and muscles the dragged shot
full on leg, and swept again! Past short fine leg, and the fielder in the deep has absolutely no chance
tossed up, wide outside off, and he shovels a cover drive to Rassie in the deep
length ball on leg, and turning into his pads further. Nudged - off the back foot - to Simapla at deep midwicket
full on middle, and he curls a tapped shot to square leg with the bat's closed face. They go across to pinch a single
length ball, just wide outside off stump, and punched off the back foot to deep extra cover
length ball, too wide outside off, and Shoaib tries to smoke a cut. He misses though, but the umpire reckons it was too wide
length ball, just wide outside off, and he tries to steer a late cut to third man. Can't make the connection as the ball goes through to Klaasen
full and wide outside off, and lifted over cover point! Clears the infield, and beats Hendricks at deep cover too
full ball, wide outside off stump. He tries to check-drive, but plays inside the delivery's line. Through to the keeper again
length ball, wide outside off stump, and he punches off the front foot through the covers! Leans into the drive, and times it beautifully for four
length ball, just wide outside off, and he cuts the shot to point
length ball on leg stump, and skidding through. Rizwan skips down the ground, but checks his shot towards cover in the end
full outside off, and he drags a straight drive down to long on for a walking single
full on leg stump, and turning inwards. He mistimes a shot to the leg side
length ball outside leg, but the wrong'un turns into middle stump. Tapped off the back foot to the vacant area near square-leg again
full on middle, slightly flatter, and he hammers a sweep to the fielder near the boundary for that very shot
full, and slow. Lands just outside off, and Shoaib tries to defend. Inside-edged right onto his body
he starts with a length ball that rises outside off stump, Rizwan driving on the up into the covers without great timing

full, wide and Rizwan flings his arms through a cracking drive. Fortunately for Sipamla, he's got a sweeper on the boundary so it's just the two ... and in fact a better throw back to the keeper might have seen Rizwan struggling to make his ground

fetched into the leg side, where Morris and Shamsi make a complete kerfuffle of the fielding effort. Shamsi was running around from fine leg, Morris from deep square, and each left it to the other to stop the ball. In the end, neither did

a maiden international wicket for Lutho Sipamla! After the fumble off the previous ball, Dala at deep cover has held a good catch. Sipamla pitched the ball up around off stump and Rizwan took on the man on the boundary with a lofted stroke, but he couldn't get it past him

what's going on out there? Malik was slightly squared up by a length delivery that he tapped back to the bowler, who fumbled his take. Rizwan spotted the chance for a quick single, and they hustled through before the bowler could recover
tapped just behind point, and Talat is off the mark straight away
speared in at middle and leg, Talat whipping across his front pad to find a single to short fine

chaotic running has brought a run out! But who is out? Malik flicked to short fine leg and wanted a single, but Talat didn't. After a bit of yes-no mid-pitch, both men end up at the non-striker's end. Have they crossed? There's a lengthy delay as the TV umpire checks to see which batsman should be ruled out. Malik and Talat are neck and neck as they both head to the non-striker's end when the bails come off. This is a really tight call. After an interminable delay of approximately four minutes, Malik is finally given out as he was marginally behind Talat when the wicket fell.
eventually some cricket breaks out in the middle, and Asif flicks the first ball he faces through square leg for one. Just a touch too short from Shamsi
full this time, on middle and off, and Talat nudges against the spin to find a single through midwicket
googly from Shamsi and it's not picked by Asif, who plays inside and is beaten
very full to finish, right at the batsman's toes, and Asif digs it out back to the bowler
Phehlukwayo returns and strikes straight away! Talat's not having the best day out there, having seen off his captain he backs away and edges a hack at Phehlukwayo to be caught behind
Phehlukwayo aims full and straight from around the wicket, and Imad is off the mark with a nudge through the leg side
just short of a good length and cutting back in to the batsman off the track, Asif hopping at the crease and working a single square on the leg side
Imad stays deep in the crease to work with the angle as Phehlukwayo stays around the wicket to him, collecting one to fine leg
Phehlukwayo bends his back on one, digging the ball in short, but his line goes awry and the ball shoots down the leg side
another wide, but this one's for height as Phehlukwayo aims for another bouncer but bangs the ball in almost at his own feet, the ball ballooning way over Asif
Asif aims a whippy pull out to deep square to raise the team hundred
slower ball from Phehlukwayo, just 108km/h, Imad waiting and waiting for it and then angling the bat to send the ball to gully
this one slips out as a low, dipping full toss, Imad glancing through midwicket
clubbed way, way over long on! Shamsi lobbed one up nice and full and Asif stepped out to hammer the ball straight back past him and twenty rows back into the stands
nice follow-up, Asif getting forward to press a single to cover
Imad heaves the willow at a full one, the ball squirting off the inside half of the bat and down to fine leg
tossed up wide of off and rushing straight on with the arm, Asif cutting hard at the ball but hitting only fresh air
quicker, flatter and fuller from Shamsi, Asif digging it out to point for one

Asif aims an almighty heave at Morris' first ball, which is on a length on off stump, but slices it high into the darkening evening sky ... Klaasen sprints back as the ball plummets down, but can't quite get underneath it
swatted through cover! Imad spots a full ball from Morris - perhaps the attempted yorker - and dances down the track to turn it into a full toss, hammering a drive out through cover

straight back over his head! Imad clears his left leg and dispatches the ball back from whence it came. Morris keeps walking in his follow through and there's plenty of heated chat between batsman and bowler
shorter from Morris, though not quite the bouncer. Imad is up on one leg to pull, but can't beat the field
slightly slower through the air from Morris, 125km/h, but Imad spots the change of pace and taps a single to cover
fired in full and fast at the pads, and Asif whips across them to find a single through square leg
he starts around the stumps to Asif, who reads the line early and finds a single into the leg side
clubbed to wide long on! Imad must have a really good eye. Beuran dug this in, but Imad was waiting for it, hammering the ball well in front of square. In fact, he's slugged it to wide long on
bouncer again, but this is a much slower one and Imad is too soon into his pull shot, gloving it to short fine
angling in towards the stumps on a full length, and Asif eases it to long on for a single
very nicely bowled by Beuran, who fires in a full, wide yorker than Imad has to stretch at to reach, toe-ending it back to the bowler

undone by the slower ball! Imad was getting fidgety after those two dot balls, and he just tried to hit this a little too hard even as he mis-read the delivery, which hit a length and cut in just a touch off the pitch to rattle the stumps
Andile starts with a back-of-the-hand slower ball that loops down just a little too wide of off stump
whoops, now this one shoots down the leg side. He's lost his radar
that's better, very full outside off and Asif digs it out to mid off
short on middle, and Faheem is off the mark with a pull to deep midwicket
floated up invitingly outside off stump, Asif swinging for the hills but hitting nothing at all
effort ball from Phehlukwayo at 135km/h, and Asif slaps his drive in the air and down to long off, well short of the fielder
flicked off the pads for a single through midwicket
swiped out into the leg side, on the bounce to the fielder. Excellent changes of pace from Phehlukwayo in this over, once he recovered from that slightly iffy start
monstrous hit over long on! It was there to be hit as Morris dished up a long half volley, in the slot, and Asif pings his shot right out of the middle
Morris pulls his length back and takes the pace off the ball, delivering this one at only 120km/h, Asif staying deep in his crease to shovel the ball through square leg
Faheem plants his front foot and heaves right across the line, the ball scooting past his inside edge
full and wide, and Faheem swipes it out to Dala on the cover boundary. Asif wants two but Faheem sends him back

Asif charges down the track and slices out to deep cover! Morris has his second with a ball that was full and wide - wide enough that Asif couldn't control his lofted drive, and van der Dussen holds a regulation boundary catch
on a length, just outside off, and it's punted to long off for one

now Faheem finds the boundary rider! He lined up a full ball from Beuran and tried to hit it down the ground, but he just didn't get enough on it. Miller was the fielder down at long on, and he made no mistake. He usually doesn't
very wide outside off and Shadab flings his bat out at it, top edging down to third man on the bounce

and another one! Pakistan are giving South Africa fielding practice under lights. Amir drives flamboyantly at his first ball but picks out van der Dussen on the deep cover boundary. He barely had to move out there.
nudged through gully for a single
Beuran welcomes Afridi to the crease with a bumper that rises past his grille on a middle stump line, the no. 11 ducking underneath it
full on off stump, and it's defended back to the bowler
a very slow back of the hand slower ball to start, and Shadab swipes it in the air towards Miller at deep mid off, the ball falling just in front of the fielder
Pakistan need a few more of these! Shadab lets his bottom hand do the work, lifting the ball handsomely over wide long off
slapped hard down to long on now, where the fielder over-runs the ball and allows them back for a second
no pace at all on this one as it came out of Phehlukwayo's hand at 96km/h, but plenty of pace on it as it pinged off the bat, Shadab clubbing another one down the ground
sprayed down the leg side, and he'll have to bowl that one again
full, outside off, and Shadab misses a huge heave at it
Shadab ends the innings in style! Phehlukwayo offers up length on middle and Shadab lines him up and monsters the ball onto the grass banks beyond midwicket
length ball, wide outside off, and enough width for Hendricks. Makes use of the rare loose ball from Imad, and slaps a cut past point for four
full on off, and sliding inwards. Defended towards the on-side
length ball, just outside off, and punched off the back foot to mid off
full on off, and he taps this towards the fielder at long-on for a walking single
another slider, length ball on off and skidding into his pads. Chops a leg-side whip right into his pads
length ball on off again to end the over. Punched off the back foot to short midwicket
full on leg stump, and he misses the flick. Ball hits his front leg, and they appeal for lbw in unison! Not given...pitched outside leg stump

caught and bowled! Soft dismissal. Length ball on leg stump, but some extra bounce surprises Hendricks. He's onto a defensive shot too early, and the ball lobs into the air. No mistake from the bowler on his followthrough
full on off, and angling across the right-hander. Check-driven to cover this time
full on middle, and some late inswing. Rassie shovels a straight drive past the bowler's right to mid-on
full on leg, and drilled straight past the bowler! Mid-on has no chance either. Exquisite timing!
length ball on leg stump, and defended off the back foot towards cover with gentle hands
length ball on middle, and the back-foot pull takes an inside edge to square leg. Almost chopped on this time
full on leg, and sliding down further. Sharp work from Rizwan as he whips the bails off. Was van der Dussen out of his crease? Well, he was off balance... but he's safe
length ball on off, and the slider comes into his body. Bunted off the back foot to mid on
full on middle, and he shuffles across the stumps, before working a tapped shot to square leg for one
length ball on middle, and he drags a pulled shot to long on with the straight bat
full on leg, and skidding into his pads. He backs away and then defends it back to the bowler

through him! Length ball on middle, and going straight. Malan tries to punch with the bat's full face, but the ball sneaks under his bat by the time he plays the shot. Extra bounce, too, from Imad, and Malan's middle stump has been pegged back
full on middle, and he brings his bat down to muscle a straight drive. Flies off the bat's outside edge to mid off

full outside off stump, and Dussen has teed off! Drags a slog from outside off stump, but he's toe ended that shot completely. In the air for ages, and mid-on - running towards the boundary - can't get under the ball. Lands just beyond Amir near the boundary as Dussen gets a reprieve
full on off, and angling further across. He covers his stumps and then shoulders his arms

keeper and bowler go up to appeal but the umpire says no. Length ball on middle that's angling across the batsman. Klaasen tries to defend, but the ball whizzes past his outside edge to the keeper. Some noise, probably the shuffle of the batsman's boots, got the fielding side excited
length ball on middle, and going across Klaasen. Punched firmly off the back foot to cover
length ball on off, and the back-foot defense takes the outside edge to short third man
full on off, and defended off the front foot. Played to short mid-on
full ball on middle, and he backs away to cut. But too close to his body, so pushed to cover instead
full outside off, and driven sweetly through to cover. Ball goes through Faheem's legs, and that allows South Africa to pinch the extra run
length ball on middle, and going down leg. But the batsman manages to nurdle this away off the back foot to short fine leg, and takes a single with ease
length ball, just outside off, and punched off the back foot to cover
full just outside off, and carefully defended off the front foot. Played straight back to Imad
full just outside off, and he leans forward to drive. But the shot is toe-ended, and it dribbles away to mid off for no run
slower ball from Shaheen. Length ball on off, but staying low after hitting the deck. Batsman tried to play the late cut, but the ball whizzes past his outside edge

beautiful! Full on middle, and he clears his front leg, before drilling a lofted straight-drive right over the bowler's head! Beautiful shot, one you'll admire, irrespective of which team you're a fan of
length ball on middle, and he misses the cut-shot with the ball angling away. Through him before he could shape up to play that

hits his helmet! But Rassie says he's alright. Short ball on leg, and he tries to pull. Gloves the shot right onto his face, but the helmet grille saves him from any damage. The umpires, nonetheless, want to check if Rassie is OK. The physio rushes in to take a quick concussion test
full just outside off, and the attempted cover drive is too slow for van der Dussen. He's through his shot too early as batsman and bowler share a smile
full on leg stump, and he leans forward to drill a drive-shot to deep midwicket
full just outside off, and skidding onto off stump. Punched off the back foot to cover
length ball on middle, and tucked off his hips to deep midwicket. Enough time for two as the fielder in the deep misfields
a drifter, that lands full on leg stump. But it's angling further down leg as Dussen misses the flick. Keeper can't hold on to it either
length ball on middle, and punched off the back foot. Played with the bat's straight face, and long-off races forward to intercept
full on middle, and sliding into leg stump. Cramped for space, but manages to muscle a shot towards short midwicket
length ball, wide outside off stump, and cut away to deep point for a walking single. Imad finishes with 1 for 19
length ball, wide outside off, and he tries to drag a pull. Bat's face turns in his hand, and the sliced shot is easily taken at mid off. Amir strikes first ball
length ball on middle, and tapped away to mid off for a quick single. Comfortably completed
length ball, just outside off, and he tries to play a cheeky late cut. Ball goes just past his outside edge though, could've easily taken a feather nick
length ball just outside off, and Miller simply flicks this off his wrists to muscle a shot to deep midwicket! A simple whip of his wrists, and the timing takes the ball to the boundary
back of a length, wide outside off, and Miller swivels to pull but misses. Ball goes over his blade to the keeper
full on leg stump, but the offcutter slides further down leg. Batsman can't flick this behind square either
smoked! What power. Length ball, wide enough outside off, and he slaps a square cut through the off side!
length ball just outside off, and no spin first up. He pulls along the ground to cow corner for a single
full on middle, and driven down the ground to long on for a walking single

shouts of catch it but that's one for the crowd! Full outside off, and spinning away. But the batsman skips down the wicket, gets under the ball, and muscles a lofted shot right over the long-off boundary
full on middle stump, and he drives away from his body to long-off for a walking single
quicker ball, full on middle, and he drills a drive past Shadab's left to long-on. Fifty for South Africa
full on off stump, from round the wicket. He muscles a straight drive to long on this time
length ball, just outside off, and he guides a late cut to Shaheen at third man. Sliding effort stops the boundary
length ball, just wide outside off, and cut away to cover for a quick single. Shy at the bowler's end from the fielder, but no direct-hit there
length ball just outside off, and punched to cover for a single. Shadab a shy at the bowlers end, but he misses, and overthrows allow SA to take the single
full and wide outside off, and he throws his hands at this. Tries to drive, but misses with the ball moving away. Umpire reckons it's a wide though
full just outside off, and he leans forward to connect with a cover drive. Stopped by the infielder
overpitched on off, and he digs out a shot towards Fakhar at cover. Almost a yorker from Amir, there

full and wide outside off, and he plays a square drive through to the man in the deep. Mix-up from the batsmen as they consider taking a second run... and the throw from the deep goes to the wrong end. Amir collects at the bower's end, and then throws down the stumps at the batsman's, but Miller is comfortably in
length ball on leg stump, as Rassie skips down the wicket. Stops midway, and then checks his shot, defending it back to Shadab
into the night sky! Full on leg from round the wicket, and he absolutely hammers a lifted shot over cow corner. Played against the turn, dragging the shot from beyond off stump
full on middle, and driven to mid off
full outside off, and he goes down on one knee to sweep. Sliced into the air, and that's been top-edged to Shadab running backwards. Miller isn't happy with himself
full on off, and he sweeps first ball! Hammered towards the leg side, and too good for even Faheem at deep square leg
length ball on middle, and he skips down the wicket to defend. Played back to the bowler, who releases the ball to Rizwan very quickly... but Andile is in despite the keeper whipping his bails off
full on middle, and worked off his pads to square leg for a quick single
back of a length on middle, and he rides the bounce, before muscling a cut shot to deep point

full toss, wide outside off as van der Dussen skips down the ground to generate some extra momentum. Slices the shot after being taken by surprise, and the lobbed ball finds the safe hands of Malik at mid-off
length ball on off, and he rides the bounce to chop a cut to point. Can't beat the fielder though
length ball on leg stump, and the attempted whip to square leg takes a leading edge. Ball rolls back to Faheem
full on leg stump, and he misses the clip off his toes. Ball goes past his thigh guard, and that's been called a wide
length ball on middle, too close to his body for the cut. Mistimed to point
Phehlukwayo makes room and slashes the ball hard into the covers, and finds space for a single
turn and bounce for Shadab, but Morris works with it to shovel the ball out to deep cover

almost a collision between the fielders in the deep! Phehlukwayo launched himself into a slog sweep but the ball went straight down the ground, where long on and long off converged on it. They almost ran into each other, and neither could stop the boundary
reverse sweep from Phehlukwayo, but he misses the stroke

Shadab fires in a quicker ball as Phehlukwayo sets himself for another reverse sweep. There's a huge appeal, and he's given out! Phehlukwayo reviews the decision, but the replay only serves to confirm his demise. South Africa slide a little further
Morris drives wide of long off and calls immediately for two
a full toss is hammered through extra cover! Faheem dished up a hit-me ball outside off, and Morris cashed in

up onto the grass banks! This match isn't over yet ... Faheem digs in a cross-seamed slower ball but Morris reads it well, stepping back and swiveling into a meaty pull in the air and over deep midwicket

misfield brings four and Morris is not giving up without a fight! Faheem adjusts his length again, aiming fuller, and Morris chipped the ball in the air to wide long on where the fielder was undone by some spin off the turf after it landed, letting the ball past him

and another! Morris has power, but he can also place the ball, and does so perfectly with this shot, slicing his drive up and over backward point to find the gap and another boundary. That's 20 from the over so far!
driven hard but straight to the cover sweeper, and in any case it's the result South Africa would have wanted as Morris keeps the strike
Morris slices a cut at a ball that spins sharply away from him, but it's stopped at short third man so it's just the one
Beuran does the job he needs to do, turning the strike back over with a single to long on
Morris has a heave at a full one, but doesn't get the connection he wants, the ball dribbling through mid on
Shadab loops up a floaty, inviting delivery, but it's well outside off and spins further away from Beuran, who misses his stroke
Beuran drives down to long off, and they hurry back for the second
darted in flat on leg stump, and he's pinged on the pad
very full, outside off, and Morris throws his hands through a drive out to deep cover
slower ball from Amir at just 120km/h, and Beuran can't do anything with it but tap the ball back at the bowler
bowled him!. The last ball was a slower one, this was a quick yorker, and Beuran was late getting his bat down at it. Castled!
Dala puts bat to a dipping full toss outside off, getting enough of a connection to turn the strike back over to Morris
Amir pushes his line way outside off stump and Morris has to fetch the ball, getting it down the ground. He wants two, but Dala slips as he reaches his ground and it's not on
pushed through on a length outside off, and Dala is in Test mode as he raises his hands high to let the ball through
Faheem fires in a full toss just outside off and Morris swings wildly at it, slicing the ball down to long off on the bounce
driven through the field, and he finds space for a single
Morris bellows in frustration as Faheem feeds him a full one but he can't make anything of it, just the one to long on
Faheem attacks Dala's leg stump, but he gets enough bat on it to find a single to short fine leg
with a new bat in hand, Morris slices underneath a slog down the ground, but the ball hits the turf in front of the long on fielder as he mistimed it so badly
slugged across the line and out to wide long on, the batsmen hustling a second run
Morris throws everything into a slog but hits only fresh air as a length delivery bursts past his outside edge
well, this new bat does indeed have a middle. Morris spots a long half volley on leg stump and just helps it on its way through square leg
Morris gets agricultural on a full ball from Amir, but it's too close to him to get underneath of and it's just the one
Dala clears his front leg for a booming drive, but he can't lay bat to ball

this time Dala walks across to the off stump and targets the legside boundary with a big heave, but he gets more height than distance and Hasan holds an easy catch in the deep. The ball hit the very bottom of the bat
full, just outside off, and Morris keeps the strike by easing the ball out to the cover sweeper
down the ground, one bounce and over the rope, Morris getting a great connection on a full ball
that's better from Faheem, bustling in and firing in a pinpoint yorker at Morris' toes. All he can do is dig it out
clubbed out through midwicket, but along the ground as once again it's very full and Morris can't get under it. He calls immediately for two to get back on strike
another fine yorker from Faheem, and Morris angles his jab down on it to find a single to cover
Faheem's yorker is too good for Sipamla and he's out to the very first ball he faces in international cricket. Full, straight, and the stumps are rattled. Pakistan close in on a consolation win
Faheem aims for another yorker, but it slips out as a low full toss that Shamsi nudges into the leg side

Afridi drops a caught and bowled chance! This should have been the end. Morris almost swung himself off his feet trying to hit this over the rope, but top edged the shot. Afridi got under it himself, but the ball just popped out
canny slower ball from Afridi, and it has the beating of Morris outside off stump
a slice drive sends the ball bouncing out to deep cover, but Shamsi doesn't want the strike
heaved onto the grass banks! Morris eyes up a full ball in his half and sends it into the crowd beyond midwicket
a maiden T20I fifty for Chris Morris and he gets it with another massive hit down the ground. Great knock, but not enough to turn the game
Afridi ends the tour with a yorker on off stump that Morris digs out to point, and that's that!
